meanings.definition: Weirdies: strange or odd people or things
meanings.sent1: The playground was full of weirdies, kids with unique interests.
meanings.sent2: I saw some weirdies at the costume party last night.
meanings.sent3: The weirdies in the movie made everyone laugh with their quirky behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a collection of weirdies, each item telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a variety of weirdies from different cultures.

meanings.definition: Weirdies: behaving in a bizarre or unconventional manner
meanings.sent1: She wore a weirdies outfit to the party, turning heads.
meanings.sent2: The artist's paintings were known for their weirdies style.
meanings.sent3: The weirdies dance moves at the talent show surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His weirdies ideas sparked a new trend in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The weirdies behavior of the cat always amused the family.

meanings.definition: Weirdies: to make someone feel uncomfortable or uneasy
meanings.sent1: The horror movie really weirdies me out.
meanings.sent2: His constant staring started to weirdies her.
meanings.sent3: The eerie silence in the room weirdies me more than any noise.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question weirdies the interviewees during the job interview.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley always weirdies me when I walk through it at night.
